titleStmt.title: The fyrste sermon of Mayster Hughe Latimer, whiche he preached before the Kinges Maiestie wythin his graces palayce at Westminster. M.D.XLIX. the. viii. of March Cu[m] gratia et priuilegio ad imprimendum solum.
Fyrste sermon of Mayster Hughe Latimer, whiche he preached before the Kynges Grace
titleStmt.author: Latimer, Hugh, 1485?-1555.

editionStmt.edition: This text is an enriched version of the TCP digital transcription A13026 of text S3003 in the English Short Title Catalog (STC 23318.3). Textual changes and metadata enrichments aim at making the text more computationally tractable, easier to read, and suitable for network-based collaborative curation by amateur and professional end users from many walks of life. The text has been tokenized and linguistically annotated with MorphAdorner. The annotation includes standard spellings that support the display of a text in a standardized format that preserves archaic forms ('loveth', 'seekest'). Textual changes aim at restoring the text the author or stationer meant to publish.

respStmt.resp: This text has not been fully proofread

fileDesc.extent: Approx. 49 KB of XML-encoded text transcribed from 31 1-bit group-IV TIFF page images.

publicationStmt.pubPlace: Evanston,IL, Notre Dame, IN, St. Louis, MO

availability.p: This keyboarded and encoded edition of the work described above is co-owned by the institutions providing financial support to the Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership. This Phase I text is available for reuse, according to the terms of Creative Commons 0 1.0 Universal . The text can be copied, modified, distributed and performed, even for commercial purposes, all without asking permission.

titleStmt.title: The fyrste sermon of Mayster Hughe Latimer, whiche he preached before the Kinges Maiestie wythin his graces palayce at Westminster. M.D.XLIX. the. viii. of March Cu[m] gratia et priuilegio ad imprimendum solum.
Fyrste sermon of Mayster Hughe Latimer, whiche he preached before the Kynges Grace
titleStmt.author: Latimer, Hugh, 1485?-1555.
Some, Thomas, b. ca. 1510.

publicationStmt.publisher: By Iohn Day dwellynge ouer Aldersgate, and Wylliam Seres, dwellyng in Peter Colledge,

notesStmt.note: Edited by Thomas Some, whose name appears on A2r.
Another edition of "The fyrste sermon of Mayster Hughe Latimer, whiche he preached before the Kynges Grace", published the same year.
Printers' names and addresses from colophon; publication date from STC.
Usually bound with an edition of "The seconde sermon of Master Hughe Latemer".
This edition has "Kinges Maiestie" in the title; B5v catchword: les; A4v factotum is the right way up and the catchword is "Quecun-"; the last word of line 2 of A5r is "scripta".
Identified as STC 15271 on UMI microfilm.
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
